actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require plans for medical assistance under such title to disregard regular cost-of-living increases in certain benefits if the increase would have the effect of disqualifying individuals already eligible for such assistance.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title XIX (Medicaid) of the Social Security Act to disregard cost-of-living increases in veterans' benefits, civil service retirement, railroad retirement (under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974), and old age, survivors and disability insurance (under title II of the Act) benefits in determining an individual's continuing Medicaid eligibility.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require plans for medical assistance under such title to disregard regular cost-of-living increases in certain benefits if the increase would have the effect of disqualifying individuals already eligible for such assistance.
